tests.name: connection.dhcp_address
tests.description: The device under test has received an IP address from the DHCP server and responds to an ICMP echo (ping) request
tests.expected_behavior: The device is not setup with a static IP address.  The device accepts an IP address from a DHCP server (RFC 2131) and responds succesfully to an ICMP echo (ping) request.

tests.name: connection.mac_address
tests.description: Check and note device physical address.

tests.name: connection.mac_oui
tests.description: The device under test hs a MAC address prefix that is registered against a known manufacturer.
tests.expected_behavior: The MAC address prefix is registered in the IEEE Organizationally Unique Identifier database.

tests.name: connection.private_address
tests.description: The device under test accepts an IP address that is compliant with RFC 1918 Address Allocation for Private Internets.
tests.expected_behavior: The device under test accepts IP addresses within all ranges specified in RFC 1918 and communicates using these addresses.  The Internet Assigned Numbers Authority (IANA) has reserved the following three blocks of the IP address space for private internets.  10.0.0.0 - 10.255.255.255.255 (10/8 prefix). 172.16.0.0 - 172.31.255.255 (172.16/12 prefix).  192.168.0.0 - 192.168.255.255 (192.168/16 prefix)

tests.name: connection.single_ip
tests.description: The network switch port connected to the device reports only one IP address for the device under test.
tests.expected_behavior: The device under test does not behave as a network switch and only requets one IP address.  This test is to avoid that devices implement network switches that allow connecting strings of daisy chained devices to one single network port, as this would not make 802.1x port based authentication possible.

tests.name: connection.target_ping
tests.description: The device under test responds to an ICMP echo (ping) request.
tests.expected_behavior: The device under test responds to an ICMP echo (ping) request.

tests.name: connection.ipv6_slaac
tests.description: The device forms a valid IPv6 address as a combination of the IPv6 router prefix and the device interface identifier
tests.expected_behavior: The device under test complies with RFC4862 and forms a valid IPv6 SLAAC address

tests.name: connection.ipv6_ping
tests.description: The device responds to an IPv6 ping (ICMPv6 Echo) request to the SLAAC address
tests.expected_behavior: The device responds to the ping as per RFC4443
